pageContext.claim: “There has been a 2,000 percent increase in asylum claims over the last five years, with the largest growth coming from Central America—while around 9 in 10 claims from Central American migrants are ultimately rejected by the immigration courts, the applicant has long since been released into the interior of the United States.”
pageContext.analysis: The Justice Department reports that 4 in 10 asylum applications were denied and 72 percent of immigrants showed up for their hearings in fiscal 2017, including 89 percent of asylum-seekers. Many of the Central American migrants Trump talks about are seeking asylum. El Salvador, Guatemala and Honduras are the three countries most represented on the U.S. asylum grant list, after China. "In the past five years, asylum grants have increased by about nine percent," according to the Justice Department.
